intro: Echinops ritro subsp. sartorianus, commonly known as the Sardinian thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking spherical blue flowers that bloom in summer, surrounded by spiny bracts. The plant has a robust root system and is drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to arid and rocky environments. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine hairs, providing a distinctive appearance. This subspecies is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique and showy inflorescences.
